N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 100.4 - Exclusions from state aid

State Regulations

The following are excluded from State aid: (a) Costs incurred for which State
reimbursement is claimed under any other provision of law. (b) Expenditures for capital additions or
improvements. (c) Compensation to
members of a community mental health, retardation and alcoholism services board
(except actual and necessary expenses incurred in the performance of official
duties). (d) Expenditures for
services furnished to patients who are financially able to pay for private
care. (e) Expenditures for mental
health clinics or other services operated exclusively in conjunction with
schools or limited to court referrals unless such services are under the
general direction and supervision of the local governmental unit and are
included in the budget of the said unit. (f) All rentals for space utilized for local
governmental unit purposes, if such rentals are payable to the same city or
county as operates the local governmental unit. (g) Costs incurred by a provider of services
where the provider of services does not have a required operating certificate; or costs of service incurred if the provider of services has an operating
certificate but the services are not authorized to be rendered pursuant to such
certificate. (h) Depreciation on
any facility, the construction of which has been wholly or partially financed
through State aid for capital costs. (i) Debt service, whether principal or
interest. (j) Rentals paid to the

Health and Mental Hygiene Facilities Improvement Corporation. Notes
